column4: how do i change my swap directory in ubuntu? i accidentaly made it a partition /dev/sda4 when i wanted it to be /dev/sda3/swap
the partition was ext3 and now it wont mount T_T
i changed my fstab to say it is ext3 but ubuntu still thinks it is a swap drive
could you ask more clearly please?
sure: so there are two things I want to do
on thing is, when I installed ubuntu, i told it to make sda3 my / directory and sda4 my swap directory
swap has to be a separate partition for persistance sake
you can split your sda4 unto two parts, one of which will be now used as swap
ok , so what if I want to make it a different paritition, for example sda5
you would need to run gparted in root mode
in /etc/fstab file, you have to edit it in root mode
first you need to have a partition prepared
there is no other location for those settings?
it is unlikely you have a gui for that setting
I also want to get my sda3 partition back. After telling the installer that it was my swap parititon, it no longer recognizes it or mounts it as an ext3 partition
a partition can be mounted with a hell amount of settings, no gui could cover them all
your sda3 now contains a swap filesystem, not an ext3 system now
once swap was created there, it has been wiped probably
but I told the installer not to format it
swap is not being formatted in true sense, but it still wipes out file table data and structure
did you have vital data on that partition?
running swap on a separate partition prevents many threats
